section_id: ## 5.1 The Weinhold Metric in Energy Representation

hints.label: def-weinhold-metric
hints.title: Weinhold Metric
hints.content:
2500: :label: def-weinhold-metric
2501: 
2502: The **Weinhold metric** is the Hessian of internal energy $U$ with respect to extensive variables in entropy representation:
2503: 
2504: $$
2505: g_W^{ij} := \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial S^i \partial S^j}
2506: $$
2507: 
2508: where $S^i$ are generalized extensive variables: $(S, V, N)$ for a simple system.
2509: 
2510: Equivalently, in the canonical parametrization:
2511: 
2512: $$
2513: g_W = \begin{pmatrix}
2514: \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial S^2} & \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial S \partial V} & \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial S \partial N} \\
2515: \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial V \partial S} & \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial V^2} & \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial V \partial N} \\
2516: \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial N \partial S} & \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial N \partial V} & \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial N^2}
2517: \end{pmatrix}
2518: $$
hints.section: ## 5.1 The Weinhold Metric in Energy Representation
hints.raw_directive:
2497: While the Ruppeiner metric uses entropy $S$ as a fundamental variable, the Weinhold metric works in the energy representation.
2498: 
2499: :::{prf:definition} Weinhold Metric
2500: :label: def-weinhold-metric
2501: 
2502: The **Weinhold metric** is the Hessian of internal energy $U$ with respect to extensive variables in entropy representation:
2503: 
2504: $$
2505: g_W^{ij} := \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial S^i \partial S^j}
2506: $$
2507: 
2508: where $S^i$ are generalized extensive variables: $(S, V, N)$ for a simple system.
2509: 
2510: Equivalently, in the canonical parametrization:
2511: 
2512: $$
2513: g_W = \begin{pmatrix}
2514: \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial S^2} & \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial S \partial V} & \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial S \partial N} \\
2515: \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial V \partial S} & \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial V^2} & \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial V \partial N} \\
2516: \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial N \partial S} & \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial N \partial V} & \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial N^2}
2517: \end{pmatrix}
2518: $$
2519:

hints.label: unlabeled-example-27
hints.title: Ideal Gas Weinhold Metric
hints.content:
2524: :class: tip
2525: 
2526: For an ideal gas with $U = \frac{3}{2}Nk_BT = \frac{3}{2}k_B \frac{U}{C_V}$, the Weinhold metric is:
2527: 
2528: $$
2529: g_W = \begin{pmatrix}
2530: \frac{T}{C_V} & 0 & 0 \\
2531: 0 & 0 & 0 \\
2532: 0 & 0 & \frac{k_B T^2}{N}
2533: \end{pmatrix}
2534: $$
